item.description:
Host: Claire P cell 603-247-0897
RAIN CANCELS THIS EVENT


Time to get back out on those fabulous trails at Beaver Brook in Hollis NH. This area is just full of beautiful views, ponds,... http://www.beaverbrook.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/education-corridor.pdf
Let's meet at 2:00 PM at the "Dam Road" & "Wildlife Pond" trails parking lot entrance, located on Route 130 (about 1 ½ or 2 miles after crossing Route 122)
and Hike for about 2-3 hours, with breaks/stops along the trails.
Please know that my intent is to enjoy a casual afternoon in the woods, get a workout, enjoy everyone's company, but most important HAVE FUN!
RECOMMENDATIONS: Wear waterproof or rugged shoes/boots the trails can be wet/muddy this time of year; Dress in layers, bring plenty of water/fluids to keep hydrated and lunch/snack to fuel the body.
DIRECTIONS: Route 3 to exit 6 Route 130 West towards Brookline, stay on Route 130 (approximately 8 ½ miles) and cross Route 122 (Main St), travel about 1 1/2 or 2 miles to trail parking lot on Right.
Liability Release - AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and her heirs, and all members and participants of this Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. All meetup activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for my white Toyota Corolla

group.name: The Portsmouth "and beyond" Nite Out Meetup Group

item.name: Hiking at Beaver Brook - ROUTE 130 entrance
